alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 12:59PM MDT until June 26 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding downstream along left bank near Black Bridge begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise back above flood stage Sunday to a crest of 9.3 feet, which is lower than the recent crest of 10.7 feet earlier this week. It will then slowly fall below flood stage early next week. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/22/2023. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
